text: James Earl Ray (March 10, 1928 â€“ April 23, 1998) was the man who was convicted of murdering Civil Rights leader Martin Luther King, Jr on April 4, 1968. He was sentenced to 99 years in prison. At first he said that he had shot King, but he later said that he did not do it. There are multiple conspiracy theories surrounding the assassination. Majority believe that it was his white supremicist views that caused him to assassinate Martin Luther King, Jr. While others believe it was for his own personal ambition and fiancial gain. Many other conspericies state that it was a government that was the cause of Martin Luther King, Jr's assassination, including King's own family and claim the James Earl Ray is innocent. ==Early life== He was born in Alton, Illinois. He was convicted of burglary, robbery, theft and forgery during the 1950s. He escaped from prison in 1967.Crime Library ==Death== He died in Nashville, Tennessee from liver failure caused by hepatitis C. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:1998 deaths Category:American burglars Category:American fraudsters Category:American murderers Category:American prisoners Category:American robbers Category:American thieves Category:Assassins Category:Criminals from Illinois Category:People from Alton, Illinois Category:People who died in prison custody in the United States
